result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Charles Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman January 11, 2017 - Amend JOC to reflect $660.00 restitution to be paid during Probation on 16CF549.

Concurrent with current probation.
Court revokes DJOC on Count 1.
Court notes 53 days credit against any ultimate sentence at minimum.
Attorney Repka to submit credit within 10 days.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF82.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF82.

-Complete HSED or GED.
-Maintain employment or education.
-Defendant to maintain all out-patient treatment services.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to submit DNA sample.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Kevin Charles Rinde appeared from jail. Includes SEHR on 14CF82, Pleas on 17CF298 and PAYH on 16FO806, 15TR5778, 16TR3093, 16CF549 and 16TR6418. Case called at 1:52 pm. DA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Stormont. On 17CF298, Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to count #1. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1. Court dismisses Count #2. Atty's waive their right to a PSI. Atty's make sentencing arguement. Def makes statement. Court orders: On 14CF82, 
- 1 year jail. Credit for 418 Days
- Court Costs $268.00
-  DNA Surcharge $250.00

On 17CF298, -  2 yrs i/c, 2 yrs e/s with conditions
- AODA and follow through
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- To obtain High School diploma or equivelant
- To apply for of Drug Court Program. If accepted must complete successfully
- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
- Credit for 183 Days
- To runconcurrent to each other and to 15CF543
Payments to be put on hold until 60 Days after release

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Charles Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 9:48. Court reviews file.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. ADA Hahn updates the Court and requests the court revoke the DJOC. Atty. Repka responds. DE remains in Warrant status in MN. Atty. Repka argues. Court reviews item #7 in the DJOC. Court will revoke the DJOC and enters judgment. Atty. Repka responds. DE is waiving his right to a PSI. ADA Hahnn updates the court as to DE previous treatments. Atty's make sentencing recommendations. 
Court orders: Sentence W/H with 3 years probation concurrent with current probation. 
Conditions:
- 6 mo condition time, 5 months STAYED.
- Credit against any ultimate sentence, at minimum 53 days.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Complete HSED or GED and maintain employment or education.
- DE to maintain all out patient treatment services. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Costs
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to submit DNA sample and DE is resonsible for all costs and surcharges. 

Atty. Repka to submit credit within 10 days.

**BOND AMENDED**

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joshua Hargrove   DF:  Kevin Charles Rinde appeared. Set for plea. Includes 14CF82, 14CF172, 13CM671, 14CM31, and 14TR883. Cases called at 11:24 a.m.  ADA Hahn informs Court of agreement. DE to plead to Amended Ct 2 - Misdemeanor 346.04(2t) in 14CF82. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1, Amended Ct 2 - Misdemeanor 346.04(2t), Ct 3 in 14CF82 and 13CM67. DE sworn. Court informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, guilty of Amended Ct 2 and guilty of Ct 3 in 14CF82 and of 13CM671. Court withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC in Ct 1 in 14CF82. On motion of the State, Court dismisses 14CF172, 14CM31 and 14TR883. Recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders:

14CF82:  S/W 2 years probation, concurrent on each count but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
13CM671   S/W  2 years probation, concurrent on each count but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Conditions of probation are:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Continue with current treatment and follow any recommendations.
-Court costs and supervision costs payable through
-90 days jail - STAYED.
-HSED or equivalent.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

Court finds DE eligible for expungement on the misdemeanors. DE to report to probation today. Probation to provide updates.

Court addresses cases 13TR5829 and 13TR5830. DE to meet with payment clerk. Crt quashes warrants in 13TR5829 and 13TR5830.


  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 04:30 pm.
